sourceMeaningMnemonic: You take a <radical>stool</radical>, another <radical>stool</radical>, and yet another <radical>stool</radical> and stack them on top of a <radical>tree</radical> to make a <kanji>mulberry</kanji> bush. This is how mulberry bushes are made. You take three stools and you put them atop a tree.
meaningInfo: Imagine putting three stools on top of a tree and watching it transform into a mulberry. The science of nature!
readingMnemonic: Your <kanji>mulberry</kanji> tree then produces a <reading>qua</reading>ntity (<ja>くわ</ja>) of mulberries. Yum.
readingInfo: Imagine the huge quantity of mulberries growing from your stool tree. Imagine picking them all. What an enormous quantity of mulberries you now have.
